TopicTitle: Decoupler in same stage as engine causes break.

Articles.Content:
(Failed to record Audio )  8/

I've been unable to recreate this with the same ship on the launchpad - but it happens every time I load the save.

Using Part Manager to undock the two results in... I won't call it RUD - unless the D stands for 'Departure'.

You will note there's no explosion.  Both crafts just go off screen to the right, appear again on the left and zip away.

Tracking station still shows a ship in orbit, but you can't select it.

If an engine is in the same stage as a decoupler activating said stage caused the decoupler to activate (indicated by the shroud popping off) while not actually letting go. Found a fix after an hour, if you seperate the decoupler into a stage by itself its perfectly fine.
I had this as well, this bug can be easily seen by launching the Stock Kerbal-K2 craft.  When you decouple the main booster, the shroud disappears, but the booster is still attached.
